summarized_judgment: the order of detention was made on 12th january, 1972. it was necessary to detain the petitioner with a view to preventing him from acting in a manner prejudicial to the maintenance of supplies and services essential to the community. the order was approved by the state government on 22nd january 1972.

tagline: Hardev Singh And Anr. vs The State Of Punjab on 4 December, 1974
summarized_judgment: supreme court of india hardev singh and anr. vs the state of punjab on 4 december 1974 is an additional appeal by one of the appellants under section 2 ( a ) of the supreme court ( enlargement of criminal appellate jurisdiction ) act, 1970. the motive of the occurrence is said to be connected with an incident that occurred about 2 years before it. some poppy - heads were recovered from the possession of. appellant hardev. singh was convicted on his confessional statement and fined rs. 50 / -. on the 20th february 1968 at about 5. 00 p. m. p. kewal singh

tagline: Rajaldas Gurunamal Pamanani vs The State Of Maharashtra on 3 December, 1974
summarized_judgment: supreme court reversed acquittal and convicted appellant under section 16. appellant was sentenced to suffer rigorous imprisonment for one year. he purchased compounded asafoetida in sealed tins from the new india hing supplying company, bombay. in 1967, the food inspector purchased 300 grams of asafoet. it sold the goods in three different sizes of tins of 50 grams each in the month of 1967.

tagline: Rukmani Bai Gupta vs State Government Of Madhya ... on 20 December, 1974
summarized_judgment: madhya pradesh minor minerals rules, 1961 for grant of prospecting licences and mining leases in respect of minor minerals.'minor minerals'are defined in s. 3 ( c ) of the act, the central government, in exercise of the power granted under s. 15 of the mines and minerals act, 1957.

tagline: Rajal Das Guru Namal Pamanani vs The State Of Maharashtra on 3 December, 1974
summarized_judgment: rajal das guru namal pamanani vs the state of maharashtra on 3 december 1974 indian kanoon. the appellant, a grocer, sold compounded asafoetida in sealed tins received from a licenced manufacturer. it was found that alcoholic content was less than the minimum prescribed. appellant purchased the app from a licensed manufacturer and sold it in the same slate as he purchased it.

summarized_judgment: supreme court of india bela das & ors vs samarendra nath bose on 11 december, 1974 equivalent citations. the respondent was tenant of certain premises. when a decree in a partition suit the premises fell to the share of the appellants. they also applied under s. 11a of bihar buildings ( lease, rent and eviction ) control act, 1947, for payment of arrears.

tagline: Shaik Jaffar Shaik Mahmood & Ors vs Mohd. Pasha Hakkani Sahab & Ors on 3 December, 1974

tagline: Srilal Shaw vs The State Of West Bengal & Ors on 4 December, 1974
summarized_judgment: supreme court of india srilal shaw vs. state of west bengal & ors on 4 december 1974 equivalent citations : 1975 air 393, 1975 scr ( 2 ) chandrachud, y. v., was the case ofsrilal shaw vs india on february 4, 1974. a criminal case was filed against the petitioner under section 3 ( a ) of the railway property ( unlawful possession ) act, 1971.

tagline: Ganpat vs Returning Officer & Ors on 4 December, 1974
summarized_judgment: ganpat vs. returning officer & ors on 4 december, 1974 equivalent citations. second respondent was a well known doctor in nagpur and they belonged to scheduled caste - allegation that returned candidate became a convert to buddhism - proof. the appellant challenged the election on the ground, inter'ilia, that it belonged to nagpur.

tagline: Soonda Ram And Anr. vs Shri Rameshwarlal And Anr. on 11 December, 1974
summarized_judgment: supreme court of india soonda ram, anr. vs shri rameshwarlal and anr were vying for their eviction. the appeal was dismissed again by the district judge of jaipur who reversed the findings of the trial court on the question of personal necessity of the plaintiffs. the appeals were dismissed by the high court on 23 - l - 1973.

tagline: Gajendra Transport (P.) Ltd. vs The Anamallais Bus Transport (P.) ... on 11 December, 1974

tagline: Kundan Singh vs Delhi Administration on 20 December, 1974
summarized_judgment: the delhi high court confirmed their convictions and sentences. the learned counsel points out that there is no eye - witness at all of the alleged murder which is said to have resulted from the illicit relations between the deceased surjit singh and jaswant kaur. kaur was living with her three sons including mohinder singh and two daughters.

tagline: Kamal Pramanik vs The State Of West Bengal on 20 December, 1974
summarized_judgment: supreme court of india kamal pramanik has filed a writ of habeas corpus under article 32 of the constitution of india. all formalities were gone into including the service of the grounds of detention on the detenu. there was serious disruption in the smooth running of the train services on howrah - burdwan chord line causing inconvenience to the community.

tagline: Nemu Ram Bora vs The State Of Assam And Nagaland on 20 December, 1974
summarized_judgment: the appellant committed the triple murder of his wife and two minor daughters. he was tried and convicted under section 302 of the penal code by the trial judge. the reference for confirmation of the death sentence and the criminal appeal of the convict were heard together by the assam high court.

tagline: Kali Charan Mal vs The State Of West Bengal on 20 December, 1974
summarized_judgment: petition filed from jail wants a writ of habeas corpus for his release on the ground. the order dated 30 - 3 - 1974 made against him by the district magistrate of malda in exercise of his powers under sub - section. the petitioner is said to have gone to village kamaldighi in malda, police station malda.

tagline: Daniraiji Vrajlalji, Junagadh vs Vahuji Maharaj Shri ... on 13 December, 1974
summarized_judgment: v. 4, 15 and 30 - goda dutta adoption made before commencement of act - custom of revocability of such adoption. the appellant claimed that he was adopted by the respondent in 1956, before the act came into force, in the'goda datta'form. supreme court of india daniraiji vrajlalji, junagadh vs. vahuji.

tagline: Rangnath vs Daulatrao And Ors on 20 December, 1974
summarized_judgment: supreme court of india rangnath vs daulatrao and ors on 20 december, 1974 equivalent citations. the appellant was the inamdar and respondent no. 1 was the tenant of the suit land when the inam was abolisbed by a notice and filed a proceeding for eviction of the tenant under the tenancy act.

summarized_judgment: the appellant is an unsuccessful candidate in the election to the legislative assembly of haryana from hathin constituency held on 11th march, 1972. there were four allegations of corrupt practice against the returned candidate, that he was guilty of. the corrupt practice of incurring and authorizing expenditure in contravention of section 77 of the representation of the people act charges ( 3 ) and ( 4 ) were given up before the high court and charge was given up.

tagline: Sheoraj Prasad Yadav vs State Of Bihar And Ors. on 20 December, 1974
summarized_judgment: the district magistrate of katihar made an order of detention on 7 - 3 - 1974 against the petitioner under section 3 ( 1 ) of the maintenance of internal security act, 1971. as many as six grounds were served in support of petitioner's detention. in pursuance to the said order, petitioner was arrested on 10 - 3 1974.

tagline: Teka Bahadur vs The State Of West Bengal on 20 December, 1974
summarized_judgment: supreme court of india teka bahadur was sentenced to 20 years in prison in 1974. he committed theft in respect of electric copper wire ( about 3000 feet in length ) at hatgarui, sen releigh housing colony, p. s. asansol, dist. burdwan committed theft and water supply as well as electric supply.

tagline: Kamla Prasad vs The District Magistrate, Saran ... on 20 December, 1974
summarized_judgment: petitioner challenges the validity of an order of detention passed under section 3 of the maintenance of internal security act, 1971, by the district magistrate, on 10 - 6 - 1974. the ground of detention served on the petitioner on 15 - six - 1974 states, on a surprise inspection by chapra.

tagline: Sarwan Singh Etc. Etc vs The State Of Punjab & Ors. Etc on 12 December, 1974
summarized_judgment: supreme court of india sarwan singh etc. etc vs the state of punjab & ors. etc on 12 december, 1974 indian kanoon was the basis for a development scheme of the improvement trust. etc. in 2011, a notification was issued under. s. 36 of punjab town improvement act. 1922 was ultra vires art. 14 of the constitution.

tagline: Ram Anjore And Ors. vs State Of Uttar Pradesh on 3 December, 1974
summarized_judgment: supreme court of india ram anjore and ors. vs state of uttar pradesh. appellants in this criminal appeal were acquitted by the sessions judge of faizabad in u. p. of all charges leveled against them. separate sentences have been awarded on those counts also but they have been directed to run concurrently.

tagline: N. Vimala Devi vs K. Madhusudhana Reddy on 20 December, 1974
summarized_judgment: supreme court of india n. vimala devi vs k. madhusudhana reddy on 20 december, 1974. high court dismissed her petition claiming that the respondent committed a number of corrupt practices related to the distribution of a pamphlet defamatory of her, falling under s. 123 ( 4 ) of the representation of the people act, 1951 - s. 116a - allegations of corrupt practice - duty of high court to scrutinise the evidence of witnesses and an altogether different standard in appreciating witnesses.

tagline: Jiwan Singh vs Rajendra Prasad And Anr on 19 December, 1974
summarized_judgment: supreme court of india jiwan singh vs rajendra prasad and anr on 19 december, 1974 equivalent citations. the first respondent entered into possession of the two disputed shops on 19th september 1966 with the express consent of the landlord. the landlord, however, revoked his consent and informed the rent control officer that the two shops had fallen vacant. the order of allotment was illegal.

tagline: Daroga Rai vs The State Of West Bengal on 20 December, 1974
summarized_judgment: the order of detention was made on 17th august, 1972. the grounds of detention served on the petitioner at the time of his arrest referred only to one incident which was in the following terms of detention. the order was made in august 1972 and transferred to the district magtstrate, 24 parganas under sub - section.

tagline: Ram Sarat Singh vs Harish Chandra Mahto on 13 December, 1974
summarized_judgment: harish chandra mahto filed an election petition calling in question the election of the returned candidate inter alia on the ground of undue influence exercised at polling stations. it was alleged that the return candidate drove away the voters, seized polling stations and procured bogus votes in favour of the returning candidate. the high court framed the issues and recorded the entire evidence adduced by the parties.

tagline: Kamal Pathak vs The District Magistrate, Burdwan ... on 20 December, 1974
summarized_judgment: supreme court of india kamal pathak vs. district magistrate, burdwan, by an order dated 29th august 1972, made under sub - section. the grounds on which the order of detention was based referred to two incidents of theft, one on 25th may 1972 and the other on 12th june, 1972. the first case was dropped on 11th august, 1972, while the others were dropped on 30th august 1972.

tagline: G.K. Ohab vs State Of West Bengal And Ors. on 20 December, 1974
summarized_judgment: petitioner challenges the validity of an order of detention passed under sub - section. the petitioner challenged the validity and validity of the detention order. in the house of s. k. golaz murthuza at palsa p. s. nabagram assaulted inmates, fired several rounds at the approaching villagers from an unlicenced gun.

tagline: Jhamman vs State Of U. P. on 4 December, 1974
summarized_judgment: the appellant has been convicted under section 302 of the indian penal code for the murder of his sister's husband and sentenced to death by the sessions judge, shahjahanpur. in the instant appeal by special leave the accused appellant questions the correctness of the judgment of the high court.

tagline: Jiwan Singh vs Rajendra Prasad And Anr. on 18 December, 1974
summarized_judgment: the order of allotment of the premises in question to the appellant was illegal and ultra vires. the order was passed by the. small causes court agra, reversing the order. of the order to the. appellant is a nominee of the landlord on 27 - 1 - 1967. tandon intimated to the rent control officer that the landlord had not vacated the shops.

summarized_judgment: supreme court of india sudhir chandra singh vs the distt. magistrate of malda under sub - section ( 1 ) read with sub - sections ( 2 ) of maintenance of internal security act, 1971. there was discrepancy in the date of the second incident in the grounds served upon the petitioner and those appended the counter - affidavit.

tagline: Esharuddin @ Esharu Md. vs The District Magistrate, West ... on 19 December, 1974
summarized_judgment: in pursuance to the order, the petitioner was detained on 18 - 6 - 1973. the grounds of detention communicated to the detunu stated that he along with others committed dacoity on 1 - 3 - 1973 and 6 - 3 / 74 - 74. the protester filed a representation on 5 - 7 - 1973 but was rejected by the government.
